headline: Micron to Wind Down Crucial Brand to Focus on AI, Data-Center Market
summary: Micron Technology is shutting down its Crucial consumer business, a move that would allow the company to redirect resources toward large artificial-intelligence and data-center customers demanding more of its memory and storage products.

raw.headline: Micron to Wind Down Crucial Brand to Focus on AI, Data-Center Market

headline: Micron to exit consumer memory business amid global supply shortage
summary: Memory chipmaker Micron Technology said on Wednesday it will exit its consumer business, as it doubles down on ​advanced memory chips used in artificial intelligence data centers amid a ‌global supply shortage of the essential semiconductors.  Micron's move to dissolve its consumer business comes against a backdrop of worldwide strain in memory supply chains, with tight availability of semiconductors ranging from flash chips used in smartphones to advanced high-bandwidth memory, or HBM, employed in ⁠AI data centers.

headline: Micron Announces Exit from Crucial Consumer Business
summary: BOISE, Idaho, Dec. 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Micron Technology, Inc. (Nasdaq: MU), a leader in innovative memory and storage solutions, today announced its decision to exit the Crucial consumer business, including the sale of Crucial consumer-branded products at key retailers, e-tailers and distributors worldwide. headline: Latest News In AI Chips - Expanding AI Infrastructure Connectivity With Astera Labs Developments
summary: Astera Labs, Inc. has announced the expansion of its connectivity solutions with a focus on custom offerings to support the growing complexity of next-generation AI infrastructure. By leveraging NVIDIA's NVLink Fusion ecosystem, Astera Labs aims to provide hyperscalers with custom solutions to optimize performance, energy efficiency, and cost for varied AI workloads. The company's initiative highlights the need for tailored connectivity in heterogeneous systems, enabling infrastructure...

headline: The AI frenzy is driving a new global supply chain crisis
summary: An acute global shortage of memory chips is forcing artificial intelligence and consumer-electronics companies to fight for dwindling supplies, as prices soar for the unglamorous but essential components that allow devices to store data.  Tech giants including Microsoft, Google and ByteDance are scrambling to secure supplies from memory-chip makers such as Micron, Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix, according to three people familiar with the discussions.
